meanings.sent1: The nabob in town owned a grand mansion and hosted lavish parties.
meanings.sent2: The local nabob generously donated to various charities in the community.
meanings.sent3: The young boy pretended to be a nabob in his make-believe game of 'rich and famous'.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the fashion industry like a true nabob, setting trends effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wealthy nabob riding in a golden carriage stuck in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: To acquire or obtain something, especially in a sneaky or underhanded way
meanings.sent1: He tried to nabob the last piece of cake when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief attempted to nabob the precious jewel from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to nabob the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: She slyly nabobbed the secret document from the unsuspecting clerk.
meanings.sent5: The spy skillfully nabobbed the confidential information without raising any suspicion.
